availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
State of California
County of Sacramenco } SS

I Samuel Cross, residing in the County of Sacramento State of California duly appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky, a commissioner, for the State of Kentucky resident at Sacramento City in the State of California, do Solemnly Swear that I will well and faithfully execute and perform all the duties of such commissioner under and by virtue of the laws of the State of Kentucky
Subscribed & Sworn to before me on this 26" day of January 1864

Jare D Isim
County Clerk & Clerk. of the County Court of said County --
SAMUEL CROSS
COMMISSIONER FOR THE STATE OF KENTUCKY
SACRAMENTO CITY, CAL.

California
Oath of
Saml Cross
Comr of Deeds
Appointed
26th Jany 1864
